title: Please don't queue for a game if you're likely to lag.
body:
We have those who are aware their connection is not stable, but will "CHOOSE" to play at bad times and claim it's not their fault.


> ***"My family started youtubing, will lag"
or
> "My roommate started using internet, how is it my fault?"***

"It's not my fault, I'm not the one making myself lag"

If you cannot have stable internet within the next hour, don't play.
If you lagged last game, don't play.
If your family/roommate might browse and make you lag, don't play.
If someone else is torrenting/downloading... don't play.

Those lags and dcs are largely preventable.

every time you lag/dc, you're effectively wasting 9 other people's time.
9x20min = 180 min. That's a total of 3 hours that they can never get back.

Have some respect for other people's valuable time. 


And yes, if you lag because of reasons above, it is your fault for even queueing up.
If you're a student living in a dorm... Maybe, just maybe... Don't play, period. 
Go out to an internet centre instead. Can't pay for it? Start playing offline games.

replies.body:
Just stick to normals, bot, ARAMs etc.

Just don't play ranked!

I have to agree with this, if you are gonna lag, you should stick to aram or bots. Don't play norms or ranked because those games last longer and you can't really play to a standard that won't impact negatively on the game at hand. My friend plays with 3 fps and and handle arams fine because it is just a button-mash fest. 

On another not, people should jump in a custom to check ping and lag prior to entering a ranked que.

Only half agree. If you know someone is torrenting, or if someone is currently using Youtube, and other things that happen before you click the 'Play' button, then sure, don't play. The things that can come up out of the blue like someone watching youtube after you've already started the game or similar things, that's fair enough, you can really only control yourself.  Saying if they 'might browse' is just like saying you can only play if you're home alone. You 'might' have a car crash. Because you knew you 'might' have a car crash, the crash is your fault regardless of how it happens because you got behind the wheel while knowing. OFC thats not true, context is important. saying 'might' is unreasonable. 

I don't see how you can ruin nine peoples time. sure the other team might say 'sorry for the 4v5' but ultimately you're ruining four other people time. you just gave the other five an easier win or a "how did we lose to four people" loss.

EDIT: I'm just wondering, but how bad was the loss that made you come on here to give this special news bulletin post?

>"how did we lose to four people" loss.

I love it when that happens.

every time you lag/dc, you're effectively wasting 9 other people's time.
